body_html:
This has nothing to do with variable initialization per se. You are making a placeholder is_training, and you use it (in the cond). You must provide a value for it, even when calling the init_op.

It may be confusing to you that you need to feed is_training, but that's because is_training is used to control whether to run the EMA, and thus every part of the EMA depends on it, include the initializer for its variables.

This works as expected (even though I'm the first to admit the conditionals are easy to be confused about). I'll close the issue, but If you have specific suggestions about how to improve errors or documentation, I'd welcome PRs or comments/issues.

body:
This has nothing to do with variable initialization per se. You are making a placeholder is_training, and you use it (in the cond). You must provide a value for it, even when calling the init_op. 

It may be confusing to you that you need to feed is_training, but that's because is_training is used to control whether to run the EMA, and thus every part of the EMA depends on it, include the initializer for its variables. 

This works as expected (even though I'm the first to admit the conditionals are easy to be confused about). I'll close the issue, but If you have specific suggestions about how to improve errors or documentation, I'd welcome PRs or comments/issues.
